title: Chilcas 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Punchy out of the chute, this smells mostly of dry herbs and spiced plum. It's fresh on the palate, with good body and modest depth. Juicy plum and red-currant flavors finish lightly oaked, with peppery spice and acidic tang.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Hailing from a single-vineyard block planted in 1979, this wine is aromatically reticent with notes of pear and flowers. It drinks off dry with stone- and tree-fruit flavors.

title: Treleaven 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Cayuga Lake)
description: While muted on the nose, this surprisingly expressive Pinot Noir balances elegant black fruit against layers of fallen leaves and floral potpourri. It's a delicate, soft-spoken wine but memorable, finishing on feathery-soft tannins.

title: Treleaven 2013 Reserve Gewurztraminer (Cayuga Lake)
description: Luscious peach and floral notes contrast dusty, earthy mineral tones in this unusually composed Gewürztraminer. The palate is mouthfilling and expansive, but peachy fresh flavors add levity. It's a bold, full bodied wine but surprisingly balanced through the finish. Drink now.

title: Château la Gordonne 2014 Vérité du Terroir Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: While rich, this wine is well balanced with its fresh acidity and wild strawberry flavors. Citrus and a tangy orange texture are both attractive and give the wine a great lift. Drink now.

title: Vistamar 2011 Enki Red (Central Valley)
description: This blend of Carmenère and Carignan opens with very woody, resiny aromas as well as black-fruit depth to support all that oak. An austere, oaky, acidic palate is drawing, while toasty, herbal, roasted berry flavors are resiny and salty tasting prior to an all-wood finish.

title: Lakewood 2013 Valvin Muscat (Finger Lakes)
description: Buoyantly perfumed of blossoms and sun-kissed peaches, this light-footed Muscat is chock full of aplomb. Valvin Muscat's heady aromatics may be overwhelming to some, but they're true to type here. Enjoy now for its youth and vitality.

title: Yealands 2014 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: This is a very drinkable, plump wine probably best served as an apéritif. Hints of pear and honey mark the nose, while the palate blends in hints of allspice, cinnamon and clove. It tastes slightly off dry, but finishes with zesty acids that offer plenty of refreshment.

title: Vignerons de Mancey 2013 Cuvée Agnès de Couëdic  (Mercurey)
description: Already this wine is so smooth that it is quite ready to drink. With its berry fruit flavors that are lifted by acidity, it is well balanced between mineral tannins and fruitiness. The aftertaste is full and round.

title: William Grassie 2013 Libération Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tobacco and spice are light and reserved. The palate offers tangy cherry flavors that persist on the finish.

title: 14 Hands 2013 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of fresh coffee, cocoa, peppery spices and red fruit lead to silky fruit and barrel flavors. It brings a whole lot of easy-drinking appeal.

title: August Briggs 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A funky earthiness characterizes this wine from the get-go, an ethereal mix of dirt and forest floor that's hard to shake, yet interesting. Red cherry and raspberry come into play later on the palate, giving the wine a juicy ripeness.

title: Château Notre Dame du Quatourze 2013 Red (Languedoc)
description: Herbal accents of lavender, laurel and balsamic grace the blueberry and cherry core of this approachable wine. Hints of licorice and sweet spice add warmth and character to the jammy palate, while medium tannins and ample acidity create a solid structure.

title: Château Ollieux Romanis 2013 Cuvée Prestige Red (Corbières-Boutenac)
description: Boysenberry, raspberry and mulberry fruit characteristics are partnered with herbal notes of bay leaf, lavender and crushed violet. Well balanced, there's good lift to the medium-weight palate, with approachable tannins and juicy red-berry flavors that carry through to the finish. Drink now.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2014 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of lychee and rose water pop. The palate brings a slight spritz, with lighter-bodied flavors that linger on the finish. The style is reserved but it shows a good sense of balance.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Brooding, very varietal aromas of grass, herbs and citrus lead to broad fruit flavors that dip in the middle, with some reduction providing a bit of distraction. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should perk up at the dinner table.

title: Domaine de Nizas 2012 Blanc White (Languedoc)
description: This is an interesting white, with fruity aromas of apple, melon and pear that are accented by hints of mineral, garrigue and clover. The palate is surprisingly round and opulent, with dense flavors of peach and pineapple alongside herbal hits of anise seed and fennel bulb. Drink now.

title: Cembra 2012 Vigna di Saosent Pinot Nero (Trentino)
description: Lithe and silky, this easygoing wine opens with aromas of woodland berry and cake spice. The bright palate offers wild cherry, raspberry, white pepper and clove. It's easy drinking and well balanced, with supple tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2016.

title: Château Barbebelle 2014 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Rich and fruity, this wine is a full-bodied rosé. It has ripe red fruits and a touch of tannin along with balanced acidity. With its up-front richness, it is a food wine, rather than an apéritif.

title: Château des Demoiselles 2013 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This tough and tannic wine is tight, with bitter extraction. It is certainly way too young, hard edged and not yet showing any fruit. The acidity and freshness at the end are the saving grace and suggest the wine could soften. Wait until 2018.

title: Bogle 2013 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This full-bodied and smooth-textured wine has subtle aromas like cinnamon, mint and raspberry. Bold flavors recall ripe plums and dried cherries. A soft mouthfeel is partly due to light tannins.

title: Cartlidge & Browne 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Fruity, buttery aromas are followed by a generously fruit-filled flavor, smooth texture and buttery aftertaste. It's a well-balanced and well-rounded wine of medium body, and has a tasty finish.

title: Standing Sun 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Oxidative aromas of macadamia nuts, walnut oil, marzipan and dried lemon are happily cut by a soda character on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers preserved lemons, seared marshmallow and nut oils, proving fairly fat on the sip.

title: Swanson 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This youthful wine shows the exuberance of tannin and power of the vintage, finding its time to unwind. Small percentages of Merlot and Petit Verdot figure in the blend. Oak, cedar and herb jump out most, with faint layers of blackberry and black cherry.

title: Southold 2014 Tilting at Windmills Old Gristina Vineyard Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Fresh red apple flavors are accented by hints of nuts and spice in this brisk, lemony Chardonnay. Medium bodied in style, it's supple on the palate, finishing on a lingering, slightly leesy touch.
designation: Tilting at Windmills Old Gristina Vineyard

title: Red Newt Cellars 2013 Lahoma Vineyard The Knoll Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Saffron and spice pepper fresh lemon and grapefruit aromas on this exceptionally sheer, savory dry Riesling. A haze of citrus flavors fall like gossamer on the palate, extended by layers of dusty minerals on the finish.

title: Napa Cellars 2013 V Collection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: There's a reduced, concentrated effect to this wine, a bold expression of the variety rich in tobacco and black tea, the fruit bittersweet and elusive. Tightly wound, it benefits from air and time in the glass, and will please a Cabernet lover's palate most of all.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Bay Mist Riesling (Monterey County)
description: Lemon-lime soda, chalk and gin-and-tonic cocktail elements power the nose on this zesty, medium-sweet bottling. The mouthfeel is soft, with lime juice and quinine cutting the ripe orange-syrup notes.

title: McManis 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This very attractive, medium-bodied wine emphasizes fruit flavor and freshness along with a lively texture. The raspberry aromas and red cherry flavors offer plenty of interest, and the balance makes it quite appetizing.

title: Fulkerson 2013 William Vigne Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)
description: Despite the frigid winters in the Finger Lakes, plantings of Grüner Veltliner have shown promise throughout region. This zesty, invigorating example is particularly characteristic of the variety. White grapefruit and tart tangerine notes are cutting and spry on the palate, finishing with a lingering kiss of white pepper and herbs.
